title: ICE in codemap::CodeMap::span_to_lines when error occurs in macro

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
The following code produces an ICE (using the latest nightly)

``` rust
macro_rules! width(
    ($this:expr) => {
        $this.width.unwrap()
    }
);

struct HasInfo {
    width: Option<usize>
}

impl HasInfo {
    fn get_size(&mut self, n: usize) -> usize {
        n
    }

    fn get_other(&mut self) -> usize {
        self.get_size(width!(self))
    }
}

fn main() {
    println!("hello?");
}
```

Probably an duplicate of #25353 or #24761. I opened a new bug since I was able to reduce it to a minimal example. This is not related to the borrow checker as it also crashes if I change `$this.width` to `$this.undefined`.
